Class SMTPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • SMTPClient
  • public class SMTPClient
extends Object
    Main class for the simple SMTP client.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private static class  SMTPClient.Response
      Container for server responses.

      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Bad sequence of commands
      private static int SMTP_CANNOT_VERIFY_WILL_TRY
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Cannot VRFY user, but will accept message and attempt delivery (See Section 3.5.3)
      private static int SMTP_CLOSING
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: <domain> Service closing transmission channel
      private static int SMTP_COMMAND_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Command not implemented (see Section 4.2.4)
      private static int SMTP_EXCEEDED_STORAGE_ALLOCATION
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Requested mail action aborted: exceeded storage allocation
      private static int SMTP_HELP
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Help message (Information on how to use the receiver or the meaning of a particular non-standard command; this reply is useful only to the human user)
      private static int SMTP_INVALID_ADDRESS
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: User not local; please try <forward-path> (See Section 3.4)
      private static int SMTP_MAILBOX_NAME_INVALID
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Requested action not taken: mailbox name not allowed (e.g.,mailbox syntax incorrect)
      private static int SMTP_MAILBOX_UNAVAILABLE
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Requested mail action not taken: mailbox unavailable (e.g.,mailbox busy or temporarily blocked for policy reasons)
      private static int SMTP_MAILFROM_RCPTTO_NOT_RECOGNIZED
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: MAIL FROM/RCPT TO parameters not recognized or not implemented
      private static int SMTP_OK
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Requested mail action okay, completed
      private static int SMTP_PARAMETER_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Command parameter not implemented

      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: <domain> Service ready

      GMail SMTP port number

      URL for GMail SMTP server

      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Start mail input; end with <CRLF>.<CRLF>
      private static int SMTP_STATUS
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: System status, or system help reply
      private static int SMTP_SYNTAX_ERROR
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Syntax error, command unrecognized (This may include errors such as command line too long)
      private static int SMTP_SYNTAX_ERROR_PARAMETERS_OR_ARGUMENTS
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Syntax error in parameters or arguments
      private static int SMTP_TOO_MANY
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Requested action not taken: insufficient system storage
      private static int SMTP_TRANSACTION_FAILED
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Transaction failed (Or, in the case of a connection-opening response, "No SMTP service here")
      private static int SMTP_UNABLE_TO_ACCOMMODATE_PARAMETERS
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: Server unable to accommodate parameters
      private static int SMTP_UNAVAILABLE_CONNECTION_PROBLEM
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: <domain> Service not available, closing transmission channel (This may be a reply to any command if the service knows it must shut down)
      private static int SMTP_WILL_FORWARD
      RFC 5321 Section 4.2.2: User not local; will forward to <forward-path> (See Section 3.4)
      private static Socket socket
      Connection to SMTP server

      Standard error

    • Method Detail

      • openConnection

        private static Socket openConnection​(String url,
                                     int port)
        Opens TCP socket to a given server.

        Opens a TCP socket with SSL to url:port. First attempts to resolve the server hostname into IP addresses, then tries to open the connection with each. If no IP addresses can be resolved or all resolved IP addresses fail to connect, the program will exit.

        Parameters:
        url - Server domain name
        port - Port number to connect on
        Returns:
        Socket object to the remote server

      • getXOAuth2Data

        private static void getXOAuth2Data()
        Builds XOAUTH2 argument string.

        Stores in authData.

      • buildPlainAuthData

        private static void buildPlainAuthData()
        Builds PLAIN argument string.

        Stores in authData.

      • buildAuthData

        private static void buildAuthData()
        Builds the authenication method argument for the selected method.

      • submitAuthentication

        private static SMTPClient.Response submitAuthentication()
        Submits the authenication command and handles the results

        Program will exit upon I/O error or response code of type 5xx (Permanent Negative Completion)

        Returns:
        A SMTPClient.Response object containing the server's reply to the command.

      • getUser

        private static void getUser()
        Gets the sender username from the user.

        Stores in uName.

      • getPass

        private static void getPass()
        Gets the sender username from the user.

        If standard input is used as an input to the file client, uses GUI if possible. Stores in uName.

      • getValidAuths

        private static void getValidAuths​(SMTPClient.Response r)
        Determine valid authenication methods.

        Parses server response to EHLO command to determine the server's accepted authenication methods. These are intersected with the methods implemented by the program. If there are no valid methods, the program exits. If there is only one valid method, it is selected for use automatically.

        Parameters:
        r - SMTPClient.Response object read from server after EHLO command is sent.

      • getAuthMethod

        private static void getAuthMethod()
        Promts the user for authenication method to use.

        Tries to use GUI if standard input is used as an input to the file client.

      • splitCommandLine

        private static void splitCommandLine​(String[] args)
        Parses and validates the command line.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line argument array provided to the main method

      • help

        private static void help()
        Print the help message and exit

      • yesNo

        private static boolean yesNo​(String prompt)
        Promts the user with a yes/no choice. Returns choice as boolean.
        Parameters:
        prompt - Custom prompt text
        Returns:
        The user's choice as a boolean value.
        See Also:
        selectOption(java.lang.String, java.lang.String...)

      • rawClient

        private static void rawClient()
        Runs the raw SMTP interaction client

        Parameters:

        options - The user's options
        Returns:
        The user's choice
